newsitem.title: USA: Daschle says Republican tax proposal unacceptable.
newsitem.headline: Daschle says Republican tax proposal unacceptable.

text.p: Senate Minority Leader Tom Daschle said a compromise Republican tax-cutting plan was unacceptable to Democrats, calling its inclusion of capital gains indexing a "nonstarter."

After days of negotiations, House and Senate Republicans Tuesday agreed on the outlines of a bill cutting taxes $85 billion over five years. Important provisions, such as a Senate plan to increase the cigarette tax, are still open.
"The bad news is they produced a bill that only Republicans can support. So now negotiations must begin in earnest," Daschle, a South Dakota Democrat, told reporters.
